author: M_Dutch97

text:
I mean, they're really different games. Earthbound is a traditional turn based RPG, while Undertale is turn based bullet hell. Undertale is great because of how dense the narrative content is, and how much it responds to player input. Earthbound is great because it has interesting aesthetics and music and a solid RPG story, especially for the time it was released. One does not devalue the other.

And I understand why you brought up the Call of Duty thing, but that has absolutely zero relevance in this conversation.

text: Of course it is, it's the first installment. But it really is quite similar to EarthBound (Mother 2). Although their storylines are similar, EarthBound to me is the more superior. Its controlling and everything is better, and it's easier (Mother 1 was originally VERY challenging and required lotsa grinding). Even though EB has grinding and stuff, it's still easier. I recommend it for the novice Mother player. :) Hope that sells ya, if you were thinking of buying it :)

author: duto009

text:
MOTHER was released in Japan only for the NES.
The second game in the series is known as MOTHER2 in Japan, but EarthBound in North America because it was the first MOTHER game released there.
MOTHER3 was released in Japan only on the GBA, but there's an excellent fan translation online that can allow you to play the game fully in English using an emulator.
